These French villages have no more drinking water. The reason? PFAS pollution
description: Nearly 3,500 residents across 16 rural villages have been unable to drink tap water since July 10 due to a record-breaking contamination by PFAS, a group of toxic substances known as 'forever chemicals.'

Tour de France continues its anti-doping fight amid persistent suspicion
description: During the three-week race, 600 blood samples will be collected. Despite increased resources, the International Testing Agency does not believe the entire peloton can truly be considered clean.

headline: In Morocco, score-settling follows a former spy chief's escape abroad
description: Police officers close to Mehdi Hijaouy, a former senior Moroccan foreign intelligence official who was forced into exile after a conflict with his superiors, have been sentenced and his family has been targeted by administrative harassment.

headline: 'I regretted that road trip, which no doubt ended our relationship': How travel can strengthen or break bonds
description: For young couples or friends, the first vacation together often acts as a test. From deepened connections to breakups at highway rest stops, here are some stories about the delicate art of sharing an adventure.

headline: In Rome, the re-enchanted gardens of the Villa Medici
description: As famous as the Renaissance palace they surround, the gardens of the French Academy in Italy have just been redesigned by artists and landscape architects. Initiated by the director of the institution, this enhancement of the botanical heritage highlights citrus trees, the emblematic fruits of the area.

In Arles, Fragonard's Museum of Fashion and Costume gracefully unveils treasures
description: With a collection of 20,000 garments and accessories, the Musée Fragonard de la Mode et du Costume opened its doors on July 6. Housed in the former Bouchaud de Bussy mansion, which the architects of Studio KO have shaped into a Provençal jewel box, the museum showcases three centuries of traditional dress history.

headline: In 1945, 'Elle' instantly set a new standard for French women's magazines
description: 'The Summer of 1945' (4/6). Hélène Gordon-Lazareff, who spent much of World War Two in the United States, returned to France with fresh ideas for the press. She promised her readers 'seriousness in frivolity, irony in gravity.'

headline: Gaza: Video verified by Le Monde shows gunfire near food distribution center
description: The video was filmed in Rafah, nearly 900 meters from a Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid distribution center. According to the United Nations, over 800 people have been killed in Gaza since the end of May while trying to access humanitarian aid.
